sectionText: Topic: Seminar for first-year graduate students and second half of the introductory graduate sequence focused on the process of writing an original piece of historical scholarship.  Topics include:  developing an argument, exploring sources, arriving at a research strategy, planning and structuring an article, presenting complex data, and producing scholarship that is a coherent representation of the author's findings.  Over the course of the semester, each seminar participant will develop and write an original, article-length research paper.  Students will work with the assistance of the instructor and an advisor from her or his own research field.  Prerequisite:  HIST 593.
